title: For Sale:  Kimber Classic Stainless Target II
postcontent:
I have an excellent Kimber Classic Stainless Target II in 45 ACP up for sale. Has adjustable sights, very accurate. I've put 500-600 rounds through it. Comes with two mags, case, and everything you see in the picture. You'll spend $1000 to $1100 for this one new. Sorry no trades.

The Kimber Stainless Target II sets the performance standard for production 1911 pistols. This model offers adjustable sights, a satin silver finish and is stainless steel. Common features include the Kimber Firing Pin Safety, designated by “II” in the model name, along with rounded and blended edges for comfortable carry. Barrels, barrel bushings, chambers and triggers are all machined to exacting match grade dimensions. Ejection ports are lowered and flared, and sights are mounted in dovetails machined into the slide.

All Kimber pistols in centerfire calibers have a Loaded Chamber Indicator Port. When a round is chambered and light is available, the shell casing should be visible through the slot at the rear of the barrel hood.

All slides and frames are paired in the early stages of production and travel through the factory together, ensuring optimum fitting of every part. This is one reason Kimber pistols have unequaled performance and dependability. Custom features like high ride beavertail grip safety, extended thumb safety and Commander-style hammer are part of every Kimber pistol. All parts are made inside the Kimber factory, ensuring quality control. Model: Kimber Stainless Target II .45ACP

title: For Sale/Trade:  Sig Sauer Blackwater Tactical
postcontent:
Sig Sauer P226 9mm Blackwater Tactical. This Blackwater Tactical is no longer in business and this Item is discontinued. The Blackwater Tactical is a full sized 9MM with a stainless slide with rugged wear resistant Nitron finish and SIGLITE rear night sight, a Tru-Glo Tritium Fiber Optic front sight and features a short reset trigger (SRT)that is 60% shorter for faster return and better control during faster shooting. The beaver-tail frame is hard anodized light weight with integral Picatinny rail.The slide comes with Blackwater logo on top and the grips are also engraved with the Blackwater logo.Some of the Blackwaters features are a custom mag well, double action trigger is 10.0 lbs, single is 4.4 lbs, length is 7.7",width1.5", height 5.5",Barrel 4.4", sight radius 6.3", weight with mag 34.0 oz., mag cap. 20 w/ 4 mags.
I believe they started production of the Blackwater Tactical in 2009 and ended in 2010. This is a Blackwater TACTICAL, it is one of the very few that does not have front slide serrations, because it is one of the first ones produced, then they changed the design.  This was manufactured in Jan. 2009.  You can confirm this with a  toll free  call to Sig Sauer.
This has had 40 rounds shot thru one magazine. The 3 other 20-round magazines are still sealed in factory packaging.

Introduced in 2000 & Desigend by Ken Onion, which offers customers an innovative, even easier, way to deploy Kershaw's popular torsion-bar, assisted-opening technology. It's called the Speed-Safe Index Trigger. The 1580MCST means (serrated blade, multi-colored handle). In addition to the Speed-Safe Index Trigger, the Boa boasts a unique, handsome look and top-quality Kershaw construction. title: For Sale:  1969 Albanian S.K.S.,  Very Good Condition, plus ammo
postcontent:
Extremely rare Albanian SKS. Matching numbers. Good condition furniture, nice blued metal. "1969" model. Includes 300 rounds 7.62x39mm; mix of Wolf HP, FMJ and SP. 12 original stripper clips, vintage bandero, plus ammo belt pack. As well as a brand new front sight adjustment tool, original cleaning kit in stock.Original Sling come with rifle and bayonet on rifle.
      Will email additional photos on request. Less than 1000 "1969" models on the planet, according to collectors. Great shooter. Very collectible, and will only increase in value. Willing to email additional photographs to show  closer details of this classic rifle. This rifle was manufactured in 1969 in Gramsh, Albania. I believe it had a short life in either a War time  engagement or Albanian Law Enforcement. This gun was at some point exported to Knoxville, Tennessee for civilian sale. This rifle does not appear to have been "re-armored". The history of the Albanian S.K.S. is very interesting to read about and brings a curious attraction in itself to the gun. It shoots accurate and is very well made. Original sling and original bayonet. It is an excellent "collector" gun, yet at the same time, a serious intermediate hunting rifle, great deer rifle, and a serious survival tool. Make no mistake, this is not just another S.K.S. rifle. This one is "topshelf". I already regret selling it, and its not gone yet. But when you need to come up with money for medical cost, it's a "no-brainer". I have every intention to aggressively look for another "Alby". after owning this one, I would only purchase another Albanian S.K.S. I am not saying that other S.K.S's are inferior, I just like the unique features of this one. Will not ship, face to face only, will travel to meet.

title: For Sale:  Adams 5.56 11.5" Carbine Tactical Elite upper
location: Miami / Westchester / FIU, Miami-Dade, South Florida
postcontent:
For sale is a Adams Arms gas piston upper receiver assembly; it is a carbine gas 11.5" barrel (for use as a SBR / NFA Title 2 or AR Pistol). I believe the model is UA-11.5-C-TE-556. It has a quad rail forearm, normal adams piston gas block, bcg, etc. I'm selling it because I have two (2) 5.56 11.5" uppers and am interested in swapping to calibers.  It has about 180-190 220-230 rounds through it, barely broken in and runs smooth and best on 62gr wolf/brown/silver or 62gr lake city AP ammo (both brass and steel/zinc case): easy to clean piston design.

NOTE: you have to run a carbine spring and carbine buffer to cycle a 11.5 barrel smoothly; I had to change my spring (cost me $3.95) and t2 buffer weight (cost me $19.50) to cycle both 55gr and 62gr.

Description from adams:5.56 11.5" Carbine Tactical Elite Piston Upper

•Adams Arms 11.5” Melonited Barrels

•M4 Feed Ramps

•Chambered in 5.56 NATO

•1:7 Right Handed Twist – Carbine Length

•10" Extended Free Floating Quad Rail

•A2 Flash Hider

This is a complete upper which includes a bolt carrier group and charging handle. Photos available upon request; nearly new condition, had for 4 5 months so far.

NOTE - 2: ALL NFA RULES APPLY; SOLD AS IS, I'M NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR WHAT YOU DO WITH THIS ITEM. You must have a registered SBR receiver to legally possess this upper if you own an AR receiver or you must possess and intend to use this only on a AR Pistol lower.

SELLING JUST THE UPPER WITH BCG, NO ACCESSORIES: NOTHING ELSE IS INCLUDED (NOT THE LOWER, NO SIGHTS, NO SLING MOUNT, NO RAIL COVERS, JUST THE UPPER ASSEMBLY AS IS FROM ADAMS).

Retails for $1100; for sale $750 cash face to face, willing to trade it for (if you have) a Chiappa 22lr upper and $475 cash (bal/difference).  Willing to ship it to you USPS or UPS, if not local, but payment MUST then be USPS Money Order (no paypal and no western union) or a check with waiting period.

postcontent:
I am selling my S&W 686 that I bought about a year and a half ago so that I can afford to move to my new job. David

title: For Sale:  Guide Rod Laser for GLOCK 19/23/32/38
postcontent:
Features: Totally internal-cannot be knocked out of alignment. No permanent modification to gun-remove it anytime. No need to change holster or give up your rail flashlight. Compatible with your favorite grips and aftermarket accessories. Drops into place, replaces original recoil spring guide Ambidextrous switch in custom take-down lever. Deliberate on/off activation-no squeezing the grip, no shaking. Pulsating beam for increased visibility. Factory aligned.
https://www.lasermax.com/ProductDetails/tabid/127/ProductID/287/lms-1131p/Default.aspx 

This unit was installed on a new G19, the customer fired one magazine through the Glock and decided that Tridium sights and a Guide Rod Laser was excessive. We removed the laser and installed the original guide rod in the G19, then bought the entire package back. We're calling it LNIB.
